malum.effect.curio.wheel_of_adaptive_res: Up to 30% adaptive resistance to damage
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.enchantme:
Today I confirm a hypothesis derived from the strange workings of my encyclopedia: Enchantments can be dislodged. 
 
 Enchantments are usually imprinted upon the very source of an object in the Universal Tongue.

Typically the Enchantment process imprints at random. However, at the cost of the source material, the Enchantment can be transferred. 
 This is often inefficient and wasteful of my carefully collected Tomes.

The solution to this I have named the 'Enchantment Workbench'. 
 By placing a book and empowering an arcane working with a set of Arcana I have lifted the Enchantments off nearby items I placed on pedestals, rendering the items inert, but combining all present enchantments onto the centre book.

Oddly, there seems to be some counter resonance when Soulwood is introduced into the equation. Items placed on a Soulwood Pedestal are seemingly imbued with malevolent energy, stripping the final items of all similar enchantments. 

 Introducing an Umbral into the natural set of Arcana generates an anomalous result
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_rite: Research into the arcane is often resource intensive. I often find the need to construct large contraptions to harvest the spirits I need. Unfortunately I had lacked an efficient method to collect and store the resources generated.

As I was struggling to construct the spirit generators I noticed my open research notes. A new way to utilise Rites was revealed to me, a way to Pull creatures into traps and items into containers. 
 Suspiciously convenient. But, welcome regardless.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze.spir: During my research into the newfound channeling of Umbral Arcana, I focused my efforts on utilizing this property to enlarge the space of my pouch. One of my experiments resulted in the creation of what I am now calling the Spirit-Channel Pouch.

Initially, when I first stumbled upon this discovery, I intended to name it 'The Void Pouch,' as it seemed empty whenever I attempted to retrieve its contents. I naturally assumed the items were being voided though later realised any spirits in the pouch were appearing behind me. While that would have been a useful application, I much prefer the effect of my current creation.

The Spirit-Channel Pouch is capable of binding itself to a specific location. This opens a channel through which the contents of the pouch are disgorged onto the other side. 
 If there IS an other side
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.spirit_sa: Through my research and applying the knowledge appearing in my notes I've discovered a new way of releasing the power of arcana. Through a specialised hilt and blade channel, inspired from the infusion of Umbral, I have created a chassis in which Spirits can reside and erupt with aspected power.

Each spirit has a different effect, the downside however is that attaching a spirit to this artifice causes it to crumble once removed. This is likely also the reason why Umbral Arcana doesn't, it's seemingly repelled from this artifice. 
 To switch out the active spirit all I need to do is hold a spirit in my offhand to insert into this Spirit Saber.

Fire - Burns through all resistance; the greater the foe’s resistance, the fiercer the blaze 
 
 Water - channel nearby water to enhance the sabers edge 
 
 Earth - Shatters defenses with unyielding force

Wicked - Each strike tears flesh as if wielded by wrathful spirits 
  
 Sacred - With every blow purify wounds and steal boons

After some trial and error I have come to a conclusion on some of the effects Physically Manifested Spirits have when channeled through the Spirit Saber.
The manifested spiritual properties are interesting and I will make a full entry at a later date.
 For now I'll just add this note as there is more to be discovered before I finish my latest experiment.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.swift_spi: The Swift Spiral is a rather curious artifact. For all intents and purposes it appears to be a Staff. However, there are a few key differences. Namely, that this 'Staff' doesn't fire any projectiles, rather it launches the wielder with deadly and disorienting force.
malum.effect.swift_spiral_tooltip: The drill that will pierce the heavens
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.sluggish_: The Sloth Brooch is a counterpart to the Gluttonous Brooch. It saps speed, in exchange I can freely inscribe runes upon my legs.
malum.effect.curio.meditation_ring: Increases Soul Ward and Staff Charge Recovery rate when standing still
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.meditatio: In my hunt for more Umbral Arcana to fuel my studies, to research this strange connection and create new pages in my Encyclopedia I have run into some trouble. Most creatures are consumed by the Well, only those True Souls are rejected. Not even the local Villagers drop Umbral spirits when slain with Veil's Edge.

I have found others who contain True Souls, though the harvesting of Umbral Essence from didn't remain undiscovered. I was struck low in a previous pursuit from a reclusive master of arcana. As I was hiding from my pursuer, recovering my resources, the ink of my encyclopedia warped and flexed into two new entries.
malum.effect.curio.compromise_ring: Compromise an enemy Mage's Soul Integrity
malum.effect.curio.charge_necklace: Consumes Spirits to increase Charge recovery
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.charge_ne:
A fused consciousness, a suspected Soul from another, the spirits of the deceased. This necklace allows me to harness death and souls themselves to increase the speed at which my Staff recovers. 
 This Necklace exhibits an attraction force capable of pulling spirits straight from my Soulwoven pouch. Although, it seems that the Ravenous pouch is immune to this effect.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.rune_of_e: The Rune of Eir, inspired by a fear of failure. The desire to strive for a better end made manifest through runework recovers soulward faster when beaten down.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.rune_of_f: The Rune of Fafnir, inspired by a fear of corruption. The desire to corrupt made manifest through runework corrupts its bearer.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.rune_of_y: The Rune of Ymir, inspired by a fear of heights. The desire to fall made manifest through runework drags flying creatures down.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.rune_of_g: The Rune of Gymir, inspired by a fear of the depths. The desire of the drowning to drag down their saviours made manifest through runework pulls struck creatures to the depths.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.rune_of_b: The Rune of Mimir, inspired by a fear of the unseen. The desire to reveal made manifest through runework reveals invisible entities nearby.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.rune_of_o: The Rune of Svalinn, inspired by the fear of harm. The desire to not feel pain manifests itself by shifting the bearers body between planes.
malum.effect.curio.blighted_presence: Occasionally inflict blight upon your attackers
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.rune_of_b: The Rune of Hodr, inspired by the fear of infinity. The desire to bring an end to the endless manifests by corrupting an entity's ability to restore themselves.
effect.gaze.sword_domain.desc: Strength of your Sword Domain Geas
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.rune_of_t: The Rune of Nott, inspired by the fear of The dark. The desire to do whatever is needed to find safety manifests by lashing out into the darkness.
malum.effect.curio.rune_of_void: Physical attacks inflict void damage on armoured foes
malum.gui.book.entry.pact_of_encroaching: [That is not dead which can eternal lie]
malum.gui.book.entry.domain_of_swords.de: [The sword is my heart; unyielding, unbroken.]
gaze.gui.geas.pact_of_encroaching.pros:
$m0.69/$Your body, a conduit. Your soul, laid bare. 
 -Armour and toughness converted to Soul Ward Capacity and Integrity 
 -Additional Healing Received is converted to Soul Ward Recovery 
 - 50% Attack Damage converted to Magic Damage
gaze.gui.geas.pact_of_encroaching.cons:
Unspoiled by Malignancy, The vessel sacred. 
 -Reduces Malignant Conversion
gaze.gui.geas.domain_of_swords.pros:
$m0.75/$Body, Soul and Sword as One. 
 -Strike foes to summon Sword Constructs 
 -Infuse your Sword with your Spirit to deal increased damage
gaze.gui.geas.domain_of_swords.cons:
When the Heart breaks, the Sword splinters. 
 -Reduces Magic Damage 
 -Reduces Non-Sword Damage
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.soul_rapi: My Scythes damage both body and soul, with Tyrving I weaponized a 'snap back' effect to multiply my damage at the cost of a narrow range.

This wasn't enough for whatever is writing these entries in my encyclopedia, it has seen fit to... modernise my repertoire. With the Soul Rapier I instead manipulate the elastic properties of a soul. Rather than weaponize the 'snap back', I instead rely on Malignant Pewters tendency to strike low the soul itself. 
 Scythes are still cooler.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.splintere:
With a snap and a crack the world was split in two. 
 Well, not entirely. I opened a gate between two realms, this act of travel, of piercing the veil that separates realms was not without consequences.

The Splintered World is a consequence and a reflection of actions I've taken, forever a reminder of what I have done. 
 Of the secrets I've seen. 
 Of the lives I snuffed out. 
 Of the thing I've let in. 
 Of the horrors yet to come.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.seidhr.1: Fused Consciousness can add impulse to action, Umbral Arcana despite being a void is power. Without power, impulse is meaningless.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.seidhr.2: Casting a Fused Consciousness in the structure of Umbral arcana grants it a connection and a mind. Though this mind is instantly destroyed, what remains behind is a fusion of both form and function.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.seidhr.3: Seidhr creates voids and fires them off into the world. Normally an artificial void is a fragile thing, fleeting and blinking out of existence at the merest tough. However, it seems the fusion of the immutable properties of Umbral arcana and the inclination of Infernal Arcana can strengthen the boundary between realities.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.seidhr.4: This staff drains the living essence of those it strikes to recover the arcane charge it consumes to cast its bolts of rending void.
malum.effect.splintered_world_effect: What's left when the world splinters?
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze.soul: Through my research I stumbled upon a potential use for Umbral Arcana. I hit a roadblock during my investigations on the physical properties of the arcana. Though, through experimentation I have discovered natural reflections, or representations, of natural arcana, leading me to ask 'What would be the natural analog of Umbral'.

Through the research into the Weeping Well and the Umbral Arcana that splintered off my soul I have discovered a new potential avenue of research. I intend to attempt to infuse this Arcana, leveraging its void properties and following up on my infusion theory. The only question is; what should I infuse?

Where traditional arcana imbue their traits through impulse, Umbral represents a void, a negation and a subtraction. It's a pulling force, introspective just like the soul. I thought to myself, what better vessel for a void, an absence, a pulling, than the complete opposite? My encyclopedia, a reflection of my presence, my soul and everything I have discovered.

Where traditional arcana imbue their traits through impulse, Umbral represents a void, an absence. It's a null impulse, introspective just like the soul. I suspect there is no better vessel for a void, an absence, a pulling, than the complete opposite, my encyclopedia. A reflection of my soul, presence and everything I have discovered.

Upon a Spirit Altar I infused Umbral Arcana into my notes. The ink dimmed, the parchment turned brittle and blackened, yet did not burn. And then -$isomething answered/$. Not a void, not a feeling. A knowing. The pages rearranged themselves when I wasn't looking. Diagrams I never drew pulled from somewhere else in my own handwriting, subtly altered.
The book had become a channel. But, to what?
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze.gift: I did not write these pages. They were blank this morning. Now they are full—diagrams in clean lines, measurements I do not remember taking, notes in my hand but not of my thought. The book has changed again. It offers me something: a gift? A curse?

A blade. Forged not from steel or bone, but from a logic I do not understand. The pages do not describe what it is, only what it is $inot/$: not bound to mass, not shaped by heat, not tempered by craft. It is a void made sharp.
The instructions are clear, even as they refuse to explain. Craft a crystal structure of Arcana in a vessel of soulwood. Feed it fruits of corruption: a chunk of blight, living flesh, and cursed sap.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze.veil: The Veil's Edge. That's the name that appeared in my notes when I finished infusing it. No matter how suspicious any true Magus would never let an opportunity like this slip by. Often when conducting my research I have had the need to get my hands dirty.

This dagger has a similar crystalline structure to other curiosities I have crafted, but, rather than giving it a mind that hates, the negative and maleficent properties of cursed matter and living flesh has given it a hunger. It seeks out essence bearing creatures and cleaves into their soul. More study is needed, but I fear the implications should such a weapon be turned upon myself.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.veil_dagg:
The Veil's Edge hums in my hands, whispers in the recesses of my mind, suggesting unthinkable acts in the presence of villagers and other Magus like myself. 

 I think I know what it wants. at first there are gentle nudges but every time I give in, it grows stronger.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.headline.gaze_: A connection through Time and Space
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_less: A simple rite, while active it will regenerate Soul Ward.
malum.gui.rite.gaze_lesser_arcane_rite.e: Emits a pulse that repairs soulward
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_grea: An advanced rite, while active it will weave a Grounded Rite locus. While this Locus travels it will collect items into nearby containers.
Pulls items and spirits into inventories, spirits and spirit jars take priority
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: A simple rite, while active it will repel nearby creatures.
malum.gui.rite.effect.gaze_lesser_arcane: Emits a pulse that pushes away nearby creatures
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: An advanced rite, while active it saps the energy of nearby creatures.
malum.gui.rite.effect.gaze_greater_arcan: All creatures will lose hunger while in range of the totem
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_less: A simple rite, while active it will attempt to pull nearby creatures.
malum.gui.rite.effect.corrupt.gaze_lesse: Emits a pulse that pulls in nearby creatures
Provides Elytras a large boost in momentum.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_grea: An advanced rite, while active it will propel any nearby player falling with style.
malum.gui.rite.effect.corrupt.gaze_great: Provides Elytras a large boost in momentum.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: A simple rite, while active it will repel nearby creatures.
malum.gui.rite.effect.gaze_lesser_aerial: Emits a pulse that pushes away nearby creatures
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: An advanced rite, while active it will weaves a Grounded Rite Locus. Falling blocks near the Locus will be propelled in the direction the Locus travels
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_less: A simple rite, when activated it will conjure or dispel dark clouds.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_grea: An advanced rite, while active it will drench nearby mobs.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: A simple rite, while active it will weaves a Grounded Rite Locus. Where this Locus travels heat sources are extinguished.
malum.gui.rite.corrupt_gaze_greater_aque: While raining, nearby creatures are struck by lightning
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: An advanced rite, while active it will strike nearby mobs with lightning
malum.gui.rite.effect.gaze_greater_aqueo: While raining, nearby creatures are struck by lightning
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_less: A simple rite, while active it will weaves a Grounded Rite Locus. Where this Locus travels crops will be harvested.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_grea: An advanced rite, while active it will weaves a Grounded Rite Locus. The Locus will plant crops on nearby farmland much like villagers
malum.gui.rite.gaze_greater_earthen_rite: Plants items like seeds and carrots onto farmland
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: A simple rite, it will grant nearby players luck.

An advanced rite, while active it will weaves a Grounded Rite Locus. The Locus will place nearby items onto blocks 
 Warning: There is a gimmick
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_less: A simple rite, while active it will weaves a Grounded Rite Locus. The Locus will attempt to convert nearby Stone to Netherrack.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_grea: An advanced rite, while active it will ignite nearby creatures.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: A simple rite, while active it will weaves a Grounded Rite Locus. The Locus will attempt to melt Netherrack into Lava.
An advanced rite, while active it prevents certain mobs from Zombifying in the Overworld.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_less:
A simple rite, while active it will purify Zombie Villagers. 
 You won't get credit for this.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_grea: An advanced rite, while active it will weaves a Grounded Rite Locus. Where this Locus travels Carrots, Melons and Malignant lead are converted into gold.
Gold-inator a number of Carrots or Watermelon Slices
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: A simple rite, while active it will Zombify nearby Villagers.
malum.gui.rite.corrupt_gaze_lesser_sacre: Emits a pulse that Zombifies nearby Villagers
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: An advanced rite, while active it will regenerate cake and make it more nutritious.
malum.gui.rite.corrupt_gaze_greater_sacr: Applies the Joyful effect and regenerates cake over time
effect.gaze.joyful.desc: Increases hunger and saturation from cakes
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_less: A simple rite, while active it will attempt to hold weak monsters in place.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.gaze_grea: An advanced rite, while active it will attempt to heal nearby Monsters. Even the undead.
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: A simple rite, while active it will drain hunger.
malum.gui.rite.corrupt_gaze_lesser_wicke: All creatures will lose hunger while in range of the totem
malum.gui.book.entry.page.text.corrupt_g: An advanced rite, while active it will weaves a Grounded Rite Locus. Where this Locus travels spawners will activate.
